relation: There are always officers on duty at SPC and I have always felt safe which is good because my classes were at night.
Join one of the many clubs offered or study!
I didn't live in a dorm.

The teachers at SPC are very patient and taught very well. They expect a lot from you but only because they believe you can succeed. You will definately learn all you need to know in the classes at SPC.
Fill out your FAFSA early as it takes time to process because they have so many apllicants! If you need help the financial aid department is always very willing to help and never impatient!

SPC is a great school and everyone there is extremely nice and helpful. I had never attended college before SPC and knew very little about the process but the folks at SPC made it so simple to apply and get in. I'd recommend SPC to anyone.
pageTitle: South Plains College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
textBeforeTable: 01/14/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 8 out of 8 people found this review useful. 1 of 40 Alicia from Odonnell, TX Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Categories Comments Campus Safety the safety on campus is great. students do feel safe as they attend classes, and have places to go for help, if needed. Clubs and Activities intramurals, gay and straight alliance, and so many other varieties of clubs. Great for these types of students students that are older and coming back to school. students that have just graduated and are worried about the large college experience. actually all students. Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus there is a center in lubbock, the byron martin atc building, which students from lubbock can take some of their classes. this accessibility is critical for students from lubbock. there is also the reese campus which is right outside of lubbock, that is nicely located between lubbock and the main campus in levelland. these locations make it so very easy for students to plan their schedule according to jobs and home, especially if your from lubbock. Bang for the buck i feel like coming to south plains college was a major point in my life, because the preparation i am receiving for the future will be very beneficial.
